oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Henry Jordan correspondence with John T. Wilder, 1863 November 14
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jordan, Henry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Henry Jordan to Colonel Wilder describing the location, morale, and general condition of Wilder's Brigade during Wilder's absence. Jordan notes the 17ths preference for sabres. Jordan also briefly refers to the Battle of Chickamauga.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Chickamauga, Battle of, Ga., 1863; Indigestion; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Health aspects
Crook, George, 1829-1890; Shields, Green F.; Wheeler, Joseph, 1836-1906
United States. Army. Indiana Infantry Regiment, 17th (1861-1865); United States. Army. Wilder's Brigade
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:spatial: Chickamauga (Ga.); Huntsville (Ala.); Indianapolis (Ind.); Maysville (Ala.); Nashville (Tenn.); Paint Rock River Valley (Tenn. and Ala.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: John T. Wilder military records and correspondence, 1862-1865
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: John T. Wilder Civil War correspondence and papers
